string.text: The Item is not in use
The Item is not in use
The OTs-04 knife was developed at the Tula Central Design Research Bureau (TsKIB) in the late 80s - early 90s and was intended for special forces of the Interior Ministry troops.

This is a special blade made of high-carbon spring-spring steel of the bus, which for many years stood in an anomal field, and therefore has excellent cutting and chopping properties. Ideal for cutting mutants of all stripes, and for protection against them.

Modified version of AK-12 2012. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. Used by the Monolithh faction. It has three firing modes: Automatic, Single, and Three rounds burst.
 
 %c[0,140,140,140]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Can be upgraded using a tactical kit 
 %c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Scopes: All scopes for picatinny 
 %c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] Supressor: 5.45/7.62 Hexagon Sound Suppressor

A further modified version of AK-12 Monolith. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It has three firing modes: Automatic, Single, and Three rounds burst. Thanks to the new trigger group, it is a more advanced and powerful weapon than the original with an increased rate of fire and improved balancing. This upgrade is irreversible.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[0,93,0,116] • %c[0,140,140,140] This weapon was upgraded using the "Monolith" Tactical Kit
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated Trijicon Acog and AN/PEQ-16 LAM

The version of the AK-12 presented to the public in 2016. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It differs quite significantly in appearance and in the design of a number of important units from the previous version of the AK-12 shown in 2015.\n \n

A modification of the HK USP Match specially developed for scientists by the personal order of Professor Sakhorov. Chambered in 9mm Parabellum. Designed for use in the "Specialist-Scientist" kit, it has hreading to install a Supressor and comes with an extended, 22 round magazine.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] This kit includes a Laser Aiming Module and Red Dot Sight mount.

This is early prototype of VSS Savant. Chambered in 9x39mm. This build is more popular with pro-stalkers because of the lower price than the final version. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated VSS Supressor

Developed at the request of Mercenaries, a team of scientists led by Professor Sakhorov brought this gun to bear. Chambered in 9x39mm. Twenty gravitational artifacts were used in this rifle's development and as a result, various qualities of the gun were improved to a greater degree.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15 LAM
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated VSS Supressor

[RUSSIAN ACCENT "ON"] It is rumoured, these blades are produced in very a few by masters from a groupment Monolith. Threw composition of alloy not known - it is talked to extract him it is possible only in the heart of sarcophagus.[RUSSIAN ACCENT "OFF"]

The Saiga-12 "Nerd" is evidence of Professorâ€™s Sakhorov concern for his collegues. Chambered in 12 Guage. This Saiga was purchased specifically for his personnel and is used in negotiations with especially dangerous mutants about the transfer of their organs as a gift to science. Experienced hunters look with considerable envy at the "nerds" armed with this shotgun.\n \n

Several of these rifles entered the Zone through scientists. Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. According to legend, Professor Sakharov received 6 small conteiners with these guns from foreign sponsors, but 5 of them were lost during transportation. Ruger SR-556 is an American self-loading carbine manufactured by the arms company Sturm, Ruger and Company, Inc. became the first Ruger of the AR-10 family.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Universal mount by NcStar with canted Trijicon RMR red dot sight installed

Saiga modified by Mercenary request. Chambered in 12 guage. Additional Picatinny rail mount for various optics and a massive muzzle brake compensator installed which significantly reduces recoil.\n \n

Lightweight and tailored to the harsh conditions of the Zone. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It does not have mounts for a grenade launcher. It is made at Skadovsk and Yanov Station, from where it disperses throughout the Zone.\n \n.

A modification based on the AK-105. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. A very balanced weapon with low recoil, good accuracy and high wear resistance.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Leupold Deltapoint Pro Red Dot sight on NcStar canted mount

A custom model developed on the basis of AKM by the American company Rifle Dynamics. Chambered in 7.62x39mm. It is one of the most high-tech weapons in the Zone. Used by ISG special units.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15 tactical laser
A custom model developed on the basis of AKSU by the American company Rifle Dynamics. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It is one of the most high-tech weapons in the Zone. Used by ISG special units.\n \n

further modification of the RD-74U ISG. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It is one of the most high-tech weapons in the Zone. Used by ISG special units.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15 tactical laser

An advanced version of the AK-74M developed by Rifle Dynamics. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It is one of the most high-tech weapons in the Zone. Used by ISG special units.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15 tactical laser 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Universal NcStar canted mount with Trijicon RMR red dot sight installed

This rifle was devloped off the VSS Vintorez. Chambered in 9x39mm. One of the main differences from the original is the presence of a special mechanism that allows you to fire with a misfire of two bullets. It has an picatinny rail installed along the entire length of the weapon. Used by ISG special units.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15 tactical laser 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Universal NcStar canted mount with Trijicon RMR red dot sight installed 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated VSS suppressor

Molot OP-SKS Carbine chambered in 7.62x39mm. The tactical version offers a four-rail mount for installing various sights, as well as the ability to install a Supressor. A lighter trigger was installed on this model which significantly increased the rate of fire.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated SKS SOCOM Rail

Special carbine, 23 mm - Soviet multifunctional police pump-action shotgun. Having a caliber of more than 20mm and a rifled barrel, the KS-23 should not be classified as small arms, but as small-caliber artillery.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The long 700mm barrel can be replaced by a shorter 510mm one to decrease the weight of the weapon.

Shortened version of KS-23 with removable metal stock.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] This shotgun can be upgraded with the Boar Tactical Kit for KS-23M Drozd.
A Tactical tomahawk - Multitool and breaching tool. An all-in-one solution.

The DVL-10 is a lightweight, compact, and silenced rifle in proprietary and current military subsonic calibers and has been developed for special service and combat missions where exceptional accuracy and range are needed.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated Supressor

The DVL-10 is a lightweight and compact sniper rifle in proprietary and current military subsonic calibers has been developed for special service and combat missions where exceptional accuracy and range are needed.\n \n

A model developed from the Komrad 12 guage semi-automatic rifle for hunting and protecting members of ISG research teams from mutants. The weapon has both a dovetail mount and a picatinny bar for use with various types of sights. This model has a new type of trigger mechanism , which allows firing in two rounds burst.\n \n

A modification of the AK-74. Chambered in 5.45x39mm. It differs from the standard version by the installed body kit, which includes a tactical grip, a forend with picatinny rails and a folding telescopic buttstock, which significantly improves ergonomics of the gun. The kit also includes a laser targeting device, a tactical flashlight and an adapter mount for sighting devices.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15 tactical laser

Dragunov sniper rifle with folding stock. Was specially designed for Russian paratroopers and special forces units. In the Zone similar models are usually used by mercenaries, Ukrainian special forces, various PMCs and other power structures for conducting special operations.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Canted NcStar mount with Trijicon RMR red dot sight installed
Chambered in 9x39mm. The AS-VAL is a gas operated, integrally suppressed weapon. It has a dovetail mount for various standard dovetail sights.\n \n

Chambered in 9x39mm. The VSS is quite popular among its users for its stealthy capabilities and the great lethality. It has a dovetail mount for various standard dovetail sights. The effective range of the VSS is limited to 300-400 metres.\n \n
Chambered in 5.45x39mm. The AKS-74U is significantly more manoeuvrable in tight quarters than the AKS-74, but a significant decline in muzzle velocity resulted in a decrease in effective range.\n \n

Chambered in 5.45x39mm. The AKS-74U is significantly more manoeuvrable in tight quarters than the AKS-74, but a significant decline in muzzle velocity resulted in a decrease in effective range. This special variant has a 45 round RPK magazine.\n \n
Colt M4A1 - an assault rifle (carbine), designed in the USA on the basis of AR-15 platform for 5.56x45mm NATO cartridge.\n \n
Modernized model Colt M4A1 Commando (CQBR) is an assault rifle, designed in the USA on the basis of AR-15 platform for the 5.56x45mm NATO cartridge.\n \n

A customized version of the MP-153 12 guage shotgun. Capable of semi-automatic fire like its predecessor, but provides better recoil compensation thanks to the quite effective muzzle brake. It also has Picatinny rail which allows to use reflex and holographic sights and ability to use sound Supressor.\n \n

Chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. The SA-58 OSW (Operations Specialist Weapon) manufactured by DSA (David Selvaggio Arms) is a legal copy of the FAL with select-fire that has a fully automatic cyclic rate of 750 rounds/minute. The DSA-58 can use any metric-measurement FAL magazines.\n \n
Single-barreled, 20ga hunting shotgun with sliding breech bolt.\n
Single-barreled 20ga hunting shotgun with sliding breech bolt and folding stock.\n \n

Chambered in 7.62x51mm. SA-58 manufactured by american company DSA (David Selveggio Arms). This model comes with 21" barrel. This model is used by military and Law Enforcement and can run a fully automatic. The DSA-58 can use any metric-measurement FAL magazines.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using Tactical Kits
Chambered in 9mm Parabellum. The Glock 17 is a polymer-framed, short recoil-operated, locked-breech semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9mm parabellum. \n \n

Chambered in 9mm Parabellum. The Glock 17 is a polymer-framed, short recoil-operated, locked-breech semi-automatic pistol. Chambered in 9mm parabellum. The tactical variant of Glock 17 has some additional futures: integrated Aimtech glock base for Red Dot sights, installed Pachmayr tactical rubber grip and threaded barrel.\n \n

A semi-mythical PM with extended barrel and suppressor mount threading. Some claim it was a limited series manufactured in Bulgaria.oothers insist on DDR. Some are even prone to think of it as a handcrafted upgrade. How did it end up in the Zone, no living soul can tell...\n
Chambered in 9x18mm. Customized version of Makarov PM with longer threaded barrel for use with PMM Supressor.\n

Chambered in 9x18mm. This Soviet legacy is the most common pistol in the Zone and is one of the best compact self-defence handguns available. It is small, highly reliable, easy to use and maintain in working order. It also suffers from several drawbacks, including short range, low firing accuracy and poor stopping power, while also losing out to modern pistols in its class in terms of weight and magazine size.\n \n
Chambered in 9x18mm. The most widely known variant, the Makarov PMM was a redesign of the original gun. The PMM magazine holds 12 rounds, compared to the PM's 8 rounds.\n

Chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. SA-58 AUS modernised using a DS Arms tactical kit. After the modification this weapon can be used very effectively at long and medium distances. This model comes with a 21" barrel length and can run a fully automatic. The DSA-58 can use any metric-measurement FAL magazines.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Trijicon ACOG Scope and Aimpoint T1

Chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. SA-58 AUS modernised using a DS Arms tactical kit. After the modification this weapon can be used very effectively at long and medium distances. This model comes with a 21" barrel length and can run a fully automatic. The DSA-58 can use any metric-measurement FAL magazines.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ELCAN SpecterDr Scope and Aimpoint T1

Chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO. SA-58 AUS modernised using a DS Arms tactical kit. After the modification this weapon can be used very effectively at long and medium distances. This model comes with a 21" barrel length and can run a fully automatic. The DSA-58 can use any metric-measurement FAL magazines.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Leupold Mark 8 Scope and Aimpoint T1

Chambered in 5.45x39mm. The rifle is a gas operated, selective fire rifle using traditional "Kalashnikov type" action with long stroke gas piston and rotary bolt locking. The bolt group is noticeably lightened to decrease recoil and improve accuracy in automatic fire. \n \n
Chambered in 7.62x39mm. Customized version of the AK-104 assault rifle.\n \n

Chambered in 5.45x39mm. The AK-74 is an ssault rifle developed in the early 1970s by Mikhail Kalashnikov to replace the earlier AKM. It was introduced in 1974 and first saw service with Soviet forces engaged in the Afghanistan Conflict.\n \n

Chambered in 7.62x54mmR. Relatively light for a sniper rifle but well-balanced and having semiautomatic fire, its precision is good but not exceptional. It has an effective range of up to 800 metres.\n \n
Chambered in 7.62x54mmR. Dragunov sniper rifle with folding stock - the SVDS variant. Was specially designed for Russian paratroopers and special forces units.\n \n

The RPG-7 is a shoulder fired, single shot, smoothbore recoilless launcher and is usually issued with a "PGO-7" 2.7X fixed magnification optical sight. It is a simple and inexpensive, but possess a high threat to modern tanks and can also serve in a number of other roles, making it a flexible weapon.\n \n

Chambered in 5.45x39mm. The AK-74M assault rifle features a new foldable synthetic stock with a reinforced muzzle device and dust cover. Each AK-74M is fitted with a side-rail bracket for mounting optics. The AK-74M has been accepted as the new service rifle of the Russian Federation\n \n

Chambered in .45 ACP. An improved version of a classic semi-automatic pistol. The weapon's only drawback is it's mediocre magazine capacity which is largely compensated by the hard-hitting ammo it uses.\n \n

The SIG Sauer P226R is a full-sized, service-type pistol chambered for the 9x19mm Parabellum, features a Picatinny rail mount on the underside of the frame.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit.

The SIG-Sauer P220 is often considered the best out of the box .45 caliber double action pistol.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit.

Chambered in 9x19mm parabellum. Ergonomics being a key focus in its design, the Walther P99 is a recoil-operated pistol with a fibreglass polymer frame. Developed for law enforcement and the civilian shooting market, it's employed by police units in a number of countries.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit.

Chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. The SIG Sauer P226R is a full-sized, service-type pistol made by SIG Sauer, a standard service weapon of Navy SEALs. Features a Picatinny rail mount on the underside of a frame.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Tactical Kit: Threaded barrel for using with suppressor, ergonomic gripp plates and Trijicon RMR Red Dot sight with mounting plate. This upgrade is irreversible.

The SIG-Sauer P220 is often considered the best out of the box .45 caliber double action pistol.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Tactical Kit: Threaded barrel for using with suppressor, Tritium sights and Viridian X5L laser sight and high capacity magazine for 12 rounds. This upgrade is irreversible.

Chambered in 9x19mm Parabellum. The Walther P99 is a recoil-operated pistol with a fibreglass polymer frame. Developed for law enforcement and the civilian shooting market, it's employed by police units in a number of countries.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Tactical Kit: Threaded barrel for using with suppressor, Tritium sights and Viridian X5L laser sight. This upgrade is irreversible.
Chambered in 5.45x39mm. Key features of this kind of weapon are - quick detachable barrels, enhanced ergonomics, weaver rails on the handguard and dust cover.\n \n

chambered in 5.7x28mm. The Five-seveN is a delayed blowback operated, semi-automatic pistol. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The kit includes a Laser Aiming Module and Red Dot Sight mount

The key feature of the AN-94 is a unique 1800 rpm two-shot burst function that increases the body armour piercing capabilities of this rifle. Used by Spetsnaz operators as well as Duty members to take out armoured targets at relatively long ranges.\n \n
Shortened version of the KS-23 with mounted Trijicon RMR reflex sight. This version has been threaded for a sound Supressor that can be found somewere in the southern locations of the Zone.\n \n
Special carbine, 23 mm. This modification of the KS-23 has a short 510mm barrel installed instead of the standard 700mm barrel.\n \n

The Remington Model 700 is a series of bolt-action centerfire rifles manufactured by Remington Arms since 1962.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using: MOD X Gen.3 chassis, Magpul "PRO 700" kit, Promag Archangel kit, The Deer Hunter .338 kit

The Remington Model 700 is a series of bolt-action centerfire rifles manufactured by Remington Arms since 1962. This model has the Promag Archangel polymer stock installed.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Promag Archangel polymer stock

The Remington Model 700 is a series of bolt-action centerfire rifles manufactured by Remington Arms since 1962. This model has the Magpul PRO 700 chassis and additional Trijicon RMR Red Dot Sight installed on it.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Magpul "PRO 700" chassis

The Remington Model 700 is a series of bolt-action centerfire rifles manufactured by Remington Arms since 1962. This model has the MOD X GEN III Modular Rifle System and additional Leupold DeltaPoint PRO Red Dot Sight installed on it.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed MOD X Gen.3 chassis

The Serdyukov semi-automatic pistol chambered in 9x21 mm.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit

chambered in 9x21 mm. The Serdyukov semi-automatic pistol. This pistol has been fitted with a tactical kit.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The pistol was upgraded using a tactical kit

A modified version of the WWII German sniper rifle Mauser Karabiner 98k. The wooden stock was replaced with a more organomic polymer one. The rifle is equipped with an excellent sniper scope manufactured by March tactical.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] March Tactical Scope

A modified version of the WWII German sniper rifle Mauser Karabiner 98k. The wooden stock was replaced with a more organomic polymer one. The rifle is equipped with an excellent sniper scope manufactured by March tactical and has the mount for a Supressor installed.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] March Tactical Scope
Modification of KS-23, developed for the needs of the scientific staff located in the Zone.\n

Chambered in 5.45x39mm. The AK-105 is supplementing AKS-74U carbines in Russian Army service. Ideal for CQC (close quarters combat). It's not intended for long range combat.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit

A very rare variant of the AK-105 chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. It is found mainly among the veterans of the Clear Sky group. Due to the presence of several sighting devices, it is ideal for combat both at close and medium-long distances.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The weapon was upgraded using the "Swamp Thing" Tactical Kit
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Elcan SpecterDr Scope, Side mounted Trijicon RMR, and AN/PEQ-15 Laser Aim Module

The Deer Hunter is a modification of the Remington Model 700 chambered in .338 for precise shooting on very long distances. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The weapon was upgraded using "The Deer Hunter" .338 kit
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] March Tactical Scope

Russian self-loading pistol PL-15-01 chambered for 9x19 mm Parabellum.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The weapon can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit

Russian self-loading pistol PL-15-01 chambered ib 9x19mm Parabellum, fitted with a tactical kit.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The weapon was upgraded using a Tactical kit
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Aimpoint T1 scope with integrated AN/PEQ-15 Laser aim module

A very rare variant of the AK-105. It is found mainly among the veterans of the Duty group. Due to the presence of several sighting devices, it is ideal for combat both at close and medium-long distances.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The weapon was upgraded using the "Shakal" Tactical Kit
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Trijicon Acog, Trijicon RMR and AN/PEQ-15 Laser aim module

The SIG-Sauer P220 is often considered the best out of the box .45 caliber double action pistol.This pistol has been fitted with a Threaded barrel for use with a Black Box suppressor, Tritium sights and Viridian X5L laser sight and high capacity 19 round magazine
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] This weapon was upgraded using a tactcal kit

The Stechkin APS is a Russian selective fire machine pistol chambered in 9x18mm.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit

Chambered in 9x18mm. The Stechkin APS is a Russian selective fire machine pistol. This pistol has been upgraded using a tactical kit.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Threaded barrel for using with APB sound suppressor, Tritium sights and ergonomic rubber pistol grip.
The MP-133 shotgun is a 12 guage, traditional pump action shotgun with an installed five shell tube.\n \n
The MP-153 is a 12 guage, self-loading, semi-auto shotgun with an installed five shell tube. \n \n

A highly experimental, artefact-powered, super-accurate weapon made by an unknown party in the Zone. Its gunshot is nearly inaudible, because instead of gunpowder, it uses magnets to accelerate its bullet to incredible speeds. Despite the gauss rifle's tremendous firepower, the recoil is insignificant. The accuracy and power of this gun exceeds those of all other small arms.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Enhanced computer EOTS-62 scope

An unknown weapon, the firing mechanism of which has not been established. The weapon appears faulty - squeezing the trigger doesn't do anything. It's very heavy and definitely high-tech. Of note is that it appears not to fire bullets based on ignition. Most probably, the rounds are propelled by electro-magnetic forces. One can only suspect what kind of destructive potential it possesses.
The PB is a modified Makarov PM pistol and features a unique integral two part suppressor. The PB's integral suppressor reduces the bullet velocity to below subsonic levels.\n \n

Chambered in 7.62x39mm and developed in Israel by Command Arms & Acessories (CAA), the AK-Alfa assault rifle was first presented to the public in 2016. This weapon is marketed under two brands - "Kalashnikov USA" and "Kalashnikov Israel". Apparently, this weapon got into the Zone with the ISG faction. The AK-Alpha assault rifle is an attempt to improve the ergonomics of the AK rifle while maintaining its main advantages; high reliability and ease of maintenance.\n \n

Chambered in 9x21mm. The SR-2M submachine gun is designed to engage enemy personnel using body armor at ranges up to 200m. Its main advantage is high firepower, high accuracy, and high stopping power at close range. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit

Chambered in 9x21mm. The SR-2M submachine gun is designed to engage enemy personnel using body armor at ranges up to 200m. Its main advantage is high firepower, high accuracy, and high stopping power at close range. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] This weapon was upgraded using a tactical upgrade kit.

Chambered in 9x21mm. The SR-2M submachine gun is designed to engage enemy personnel using body armor at ranges up to 200m. Its main advantage is high firepower, high accuracy, and high stopping power at close range. \n \n

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. Steyr AUG A1 in standard rifle configuration. 
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated 1.5x scope
Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. Steyr AUG A3 in standard rifle configuration. It differs from the A1 model with the presence of four Picatinny rails. \n \n

Chambered in 5.56x45 NATO. Steyr AUG A1 in CQB configuration. It has less weight and an increased rate of fire compared to the base A1 model.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Integrated 1.5x scope

Chambered in 5.56x45 NATO. Steyr AUG A3 in standard rifle configuration. It differs from the A1 model with the presence of four Picatinny rails.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Trijicon Acog (x4) and PEQ LA5 LAM.

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. The Ak 5C is the modernized version of the original Ak 5 and follows the trend of modular weapons. One of the most significant improvements is the MIL-STD-1913 rail system to which a variety of different optics, lights and sights that can be mounted.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit.

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. The Ak 5C is the modernized version of the original Ak 5 and follows the trend of modular weapons. One of the most significant improvements is the MIL-STD-1913 rail system to which a variety of different optics, lights and sights that can be mounted.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The weapon was upgraded with a tactical kit: Low profile foregrip, LA5 LAM, Leupold LCO+D'evo scopes and short barrel

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. ISG modification of the Swedish AK 5C. A rare weapon in the Zone used by some ISG squads.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] LA5 LAM installed

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. The M4 carbine is a gas operated, air cooled, magazine fed, selective fire carbine with a 4 position telescoping stock. Due to it's shorter length, it is more convenient to carry than a full length rifle.\n \n

Chambered in 7.62x39mm. The AKM is the most ubiquitous variant of the AK series of firearms and it has found widespread use with the former Warsaw Pact states and its many African and Asian allies.\n \n

Chambered in 7.62x39mm. A variant of the AKM, equipped with an under-folding metal shoulder stock in place of the fixed wooden stock. The metal stock of the AKMS is somewhat different from the folding stock of the previous AK-47 model as it has a modified locking mechanism, which locks both support arms of the AKMS stock instead of just one.\n \n

The SKS is one of the first weapons chambered in 7.62x39mm. Replaced in the Soviet front-line service by the AK-47 in the early 1950s, it remained in second-line service for decades and is still used as a ceremonial arm today.\n \n

Chambered in 5.56x45 NATO. The L85A2 is extremely reliable over a range of climates for various operational scenariosand is recognised as reliable and accurate, especially when using the standard issue SUSAT telescopic sight.\n \n

Chambered in 5.56x45 NATO. The L85A2 is extremely reliable over a range of climates for various operational scenariosand is recognised as reliable and accurate, especially when using the standard issue SUSAT telescopic sight. This version has been installed with picatinny rails for use with modern sights and optics.\n \n

Chambered in .45 ACP. The Korth is a high-end pistol; The ROLEX of pistols. This model has a 4" barrel and tritium sights but cannot be fitted with a Supressor.\n
Chambered in .45 ACP. The Korth is a high-end pistol; The ROLEX of pistols. This model has a 6" threaded barrel for a supressor and high rising sights.\n

A single shot, front loaded, rifled underbarrel grenade launcher for assault rifles made in Warsaw Pact countries. Designed to greatly expand fire-power of a basic infantry squad.

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. The Type 20 borrows many features from other modern rifles. Is not the originality of the design that is required - but reliability, low price, and compliance with the customer's requirements. It remains a mystery how and in what quantity this rifle came to the participants of a scientific expedition to the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-15A DBAL-A2 Laser Device installed
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] MARCH Tactical Short Scope

Chambered in 5.56x45mm NATO. A highly modified AR15 rifle, usually in service with the veterans of the Freedom. The body kit installed on the weapon allows you to feel confident at any firing range, but at the same time, the weapon is distinguished by a high price due to the use of very expensive components in the kit.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Upgrades: B.E. MEYERS MAWL-C1 tactical green laser aim module, HERA Arms foregrip and stock.
Like Beard, Skryaga also decided to earn extra money by selling carbines in "his" body kit. The result was a robust, lightweight, and very ergonomic rifle based on the M4.\n
A rare find. Modified version of AK-12 2012, mainly used by the Monolith squad commanders.\n \n %c[0,255,255,255]UNIQUE: %c[0,250,250,0] Hyperburst fire mode

Renowned for its high production quality and good performance, the SG550 is often referred to as the finest 5.56 mm rifle ever made. It has a side-folding skeletonised buttstock and a lightweight aluminium bipod that folds into grooves in the lower handguard.\n

Renowned for its high production quality and good performance, the SG550 is often referred to as the finest 5.56 mm rifle ever made. It has a side-folding skeletonised buttstock and a lightweight aluminium bipod that folds into grooves in the lower handguard. This variant is modified with a railed hanguard allowing an underbarrel grenade launcher to be installed.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Installed Upgrades: Tactical handguard, Vertical grip, AN/PEQ-16 laser aim module and tritium sights
The SG552 Commando is designed for urban combat, making it the most compact member of SIG's renowned SG550 family, which enhances its CQC capabilities.\n

The SG552 Commando is designed for urban combat, making it the most compact member of SIG's renowned SG 550 family, which enhances its CQC capabilities. This version is enhanced further with a foregrip for better recoil control and tritium sights for night time shooting.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AN/PEQ-16 Laser Aim modul and Tritium sights

The SG552 Commando is designed for urban combat, making it the most compact member of SIG's renowned SG 550 family, which enhances its CQC capabilities. This version is enhanced further with a horizontal foregrip providing great recoil control bonus and a modified gas system increasing fire rate.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] B.E. MEYERS MAWL-C1 tactical green laser aim module

The OTs-02 Kiparis automatic mechanism is powered by a free bolt recoil. Shots are fired from closed bolt, which increases the accuracy of fire. To increase stability of the weapon, a folding stock is used, which in the compact position is folded on top of the receiver.\n

The OTs-02 Kiparis automatic mechanism is powered by a free bolt recoil. Shots are fired from closed bolt, which increases the accuracy of fire. To increase stability of the weapon, a folding stock is used, which in the compact position is folded on top of the receiver. This model differs from the standard mainly in some simple attachments and slightly increased rate of fire.\n

The OTs-02 Kiparis automatic mechanism is powered by a free bolt recoil. Shots are fired from closed bolt, which increases the accuracy of fire. To increase stability of the weapon, a folding stock is used, which in the compact position is folded on top of the receiver. This model differs from the standard with a slightly increased rate of fire and it comes with a handcrafted Bakelite foregrip which improves recoil control.\n

To increase stability of the weapon, a folding stock is used, which in the compact position is folded on top of the receiver. This model differs from the standard with a slightly increased rate of fire and it comes with a handcrafted Bakelite foregrip which improves recoil control.\n

The Skorpion vz. 61 was developed for use with security forces. The weapon was also accepted into service with the Czechoslovak Army as a personal sidearm for lower-ranking army staff, vehicle drivers, armoured vehicle personnel and special forces. Currently the weapon is in use with the armed forces of several countries as a sidearm. Originally chambered for .32 ACP but most of the models made their way into the Zone is vz.65, vz.82 chambered for 9x18mm Makarov.\n

The Skorpion vz. 61 was developed for use with security forces. The weapon was also accepted into service with the Czechoslovak Army as a personal sidearm for lower-ranking army staff, vehicle drivers, armoured vehicle personnel and special forces. Currently the weapon is in use with the armed forces of several countries as a sidearm. Originally chambered for .32 ACP but most of the models made their way into the Zone is vz.65, vz.82 chambered for 9x18mm Makarov. This model differs from the standard with a slightly increased rate of fire.\n

The Skorpion vz. 61 was developed for use with security forces. The weapon was also accepted into service with the Czechoslovak Army as a personal sidearm for lower-ranking army staff, vehicle drivers, armoured vehicle personnel and special forces. Currently the weapon is in use with the armed forces of several countries as a sidearm. This model differs from the standard with a slightly increased rate of fire and it comes with a foregrip which improves recoil control.\n

Modernization of the PK belt-fed general-purpose machine gun introduced in 1969. Despite the high mass and unsatisfactory accuracy, it has found a fairly wide application in the Zone. It is mainly used to suppress an enemy outnumbered and when clearing mutant lairs.\n

The HK G28 rifle was developed specifically for the Bundeswehr as a support weapon for small infantry units. Despite several differences, the HK G28 is 75% interchangeable with the HK 417. This rifle is designed to shoot at distances inaccessible to standard 5.56mm assault rifles.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Schmidt and Bender PM II 3-12x50 scope and Aimpoint T1 included

The ADAR 2-15 Russian civilian carbine based on the design of AR-15. The carbine is produced in St. Petersburg with use of Israeli components and chrome barrels produced by Molot Arms. While being mostly alike other AR-15 based carbines, in order to comply with Russian civilian firearms laws ADAR 2-15 lacks fully automatic firing capability and has a magazine of capacity limited to 10 rounds.\n

SR.2 "Veresk" is a Russian submachine gun (manufactured by TsNIITOCHMASH), designed to engage enemy personnel in close combat (at a distance of up to 200 m) using individual body armor. The main advantage of the SR-2 is its high firepower, high accuracy of fire and the destructive effect of a bullet at close range. This SR-2M was improved by Mangun: a lightweight bolt group that increases the rate of fire, a Magpul stock for better ergonomics, a picatinny rail allowing to mount sights and an LA5 laser aim module.\n

The PK is a belt-fed general-purpose machine gun. Designed in the Soviet Union, the original PK machine gun was introduced in 1961. Despite the high mass and unsatisfactory accuracy, it has found a fairly wide application in the Zone. It is mainly used to suppress an enemy outnumbered and when clearing mutant lairs.\n

A major infantry weapon of the Soviet armed forces during World War II, the PPSh-41 was a durable, low-maintenance weapon made of cheap, easily-obtained components.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded using a Tactical Kit

A major infantry weapon of the Soviet armed forces during World War II, the PPSh-41 was a durable, low-maintenance weapon made of cheap, easily-obtained components. This model is fitted with a modernized heat shield that allowed to increase fire rate even more while maintaining durability.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] The tactical kit "Bandolero" is installed on this weapon

During World War II, certain Karabiner 98k rifles were selected for their exceptional accuracy and fitted with the ZF39 telescopic sight. These rifles were used by Nazi Germany as sniper rifles. In skilled hands, they had an effective range of up to 1000 metres.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Can be upgraded with the silencer adapter.
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] ZF-4 integrated scope

During World War II, certain Karabiner 98k rifles were selected for their exceptional accuracy and fitted with the ZF39 telescopic sight. These rifles were used by Nazi Germany as sniper rifles. In skilled hands, they had an effective range of up to 1000 metres.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS:

Modified version of the German WWII sniper rifle Mauser Karabiner 98k - another work of the Forester, known for his love for the restoration and modernization of old captured weapons of the WWII era. The original wooden stock has been slightly lightened; a handguard is installed on its front part, allowing the installation of an additional night sight. The rifle is equipped with an excellent sniper scope manufactured by March, Japan. According to the Forester, this rifle is more suitable for hunting intruders in the Red Forest than mutants.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] March Tactical with PN-23 nozzle

Model 700 rifles have been produced in the USA by Remington since 1962. It is possibly the most widely used bolt-action sniper and hunting rifle in the United States. It is the top product of Remington Arms. There are many variants of the rifle for different cartridges, however, the .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge was chosen for ammunition for this model for firing at long and extra-long distances. The rifle is fitted with a McMillan A5 stock, 26" PGW Defense C14 fluted barrel and muzzle brake compensator, as well as a Badger Ordanance Embedded Front Rail for additional night sights.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Schmidt and Bender PM II 3-12x50 with PN-23 nozzle

Model 700 rifles have been produced in the USA by Remington since 1962. It is possibly the most widely used bolt-action sniper and hunting rifle in the United States. It is the top product of Remington Arms. There are many variants of the rifle for different cartridges, however, the .338 Lapua Magnum cartridge was chosen for ammunition for this model for firing at long and extra-long distances. The rifle is fitted with a AICS (Accuracy International Chassis Systems) stock, 22" PGW Defense C14 fluted barrel and muzzle brake compensator, as well as a Badger Ordanance Embedded Front Rail for additional night sights.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Schmidt and Bender PM II 3-12x50 with PN-23 nozzle

A lighter modification of the PKM machine gun in a body kit made by Zenitka company. Thanks to the short barrel, this model has improved ergonomics, which makes it more suitable for fighting in urban areas. This model has increased rate of fire and an angled foregrip installed for better recoil control.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Zenit Perst-3 tactical device

A modification of the PKM machine gun in a body kit made by Zenitka company. This model has increased rate of fire and an angled angled foregrip installed for better recoil control.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Zenit Perst-3 tactical device

The FN SCAR-L (Special Operation Forces Combat Assault Rifle - Light) assault rifle chambered in 5.56x45 NATO rounds, was adopted by US SOCOM (United States Special Operations Command) as the Mk 16. Features a side-folding polymer stock and a free-floating, cold hammer-forged Mil-Spec barrel with hardchromed bore. Fully-ambidextrous operating controls instantly adapt the SCAR to any user or any shooting position. Comes in black and flat dark earth.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] B.E. MEYERS MAWL-C1 tactical LAM

The PKP Pecheneg is a Russian modernisation of PKM light machine gun chambered for the 7.62x54mmR round. The Pecheneg is said to be more accurate than all its predecessors due to a heavier, non-removable, forced air cooling barrel with radial cooling ribs and a handle which eliminates the haze effect from hot gases and keeps the barrel cooler, making the weapon more reliable, but slightly decreasing fire rate.\n

The PKP Pecheneg is a Russian modernisation of PKM light machine gun chambered for the 7.62x54mmR round. The Pecheneg is said to be more accurate than all its predecessors due to a heavier, non-removable, forced air cooling barrel with radial cooling ribs and a handle which eliminates the haze effect from hot gases and keeps the barrel cooler, making the weapon more reliable, but slightly decreasing fire rate. Thanks to the short barrel, this model has improved ergonomics, which makes it more suitable for fighting in urban areas. The model has increased rate of fire and an angled foregrip installed for better recoil control.
 
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Zenit Perst-3 tactical device
